name: raccoon
text: man, i can not stop laughing.

name: fakedaisies
text: Me either. The one-two punch of the horrifying pancake and Philippe's rictus of terror and devastation just kills me. Onstad is really good at capturing that all-encompassing crushing disappointment that kids set themselves up for with too-high expectations.

name: rowboat
text: Yeah. You're a fucking bastard. And not even a real one. Just a fake-ass internet one. Saint, whatever differences we've had in the past, and however lame I truly do find your comments, I want you to know that I do not endorse anything said by this man-child.

name: soticoto
text: A comment left by soticoto was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by aliiis, Mangtastic, clancine, aHatOfPig, zaer, Doc_Rostov, apres, slalvation)

name: slalvation
text: Oh my fucking god. End this stupid argument now. I keep thinking I've got something interesting in my inbox and it's just you people still screaming ineffectually at each other back here.

name: rowboat
text: While I do sympathize, it appears as though you, yourself, entered into this drama. Be more careful. Anyway, this should be the end of it, as I totally just ruined soticoto's life up there.

name: slalvation
text: But that was a long time ago, and this Soticoto fellow got involved long after the fact. I'd already washed my hands of it when he decided to add his two cents.

name: soticoto
text: The real irony is that two years later, I came back and chubbied all of Saint's posts... once again proving that I don't have to dislike something to spontaneously attack it.

name: rowboat
text: I know you are, but what am I?

name: rowboat
text: Oh no. My stupid response to soticoto looks like a stupid response to you, now. Anyway, I won't add to this anymore. Apologies.

name: saint
text: Yay.

text: How would someone make it to middle school without learning to read? Seems to me that passing the 6th grade would require some basic literacy.

name: saint
text: YOU WOULD THINK

name: chrisb
text: Disappointment is the only truly shared human emotion

name: laserblade
text: Or, as the case may be, stuffed otter emotion.

name: internnumber1
text: God, Teodor just does not get Phillipe sometimes. That pancake is like if Mickey showed up on 'CSI'; left in a gutter after he tried to pull a double cross in a crack deal and took a lead pipe to the face for it.

name: juancarlos
text: It looks like good ol' Mickey after rabid dogs ate his face off. All hella eating through straw, all having to wear a huge costume Mickey head to avoid scaring Pluto. Donald not returning his calls.

name: mattylite
text: Thank you internnumber1 and juancarlos! After scrolling through one of those message board catfights that for some reason are hard not to read every uncomfortable word of, you rewarded me with two hilarious comments in a row! . Is so funny. Is so good.

name: sp1derbaby
text: I wasn't expecting to laugh so soon after the series of rants above and was unwisely sipping my coffee. CRT monitors sure were easier to clean.

name: aelindil
text: That never happens on Antiques Roadshow!

name: thommy_h
text: Something very similar happened to me when my girlfriend made me a cake for my birthday. Her vague warnings didn't prepare me for what was eventually produced.

name: combustache
text: Did she try to make you a mickey mouse cake?

name: tekende
text: what...what was it

name: smilebuddha
text: Did she sit on it?  'Cause that would have been _hot_.

name: juancarlos

If only he had not told him it was going to be a Mickey Mouse pancake, and just made a normal pancake, it would have been o.k.
It would have been o.k.

text:
Liebot doesn't love it. He just does it because of his programming. So you're worse.

Out of the cerebellum of babes . . .

text: I thought of this strip at the Safeway last night when I saw, in the freezer section, a box of frozen hamburger patties shaped like Mickey's head. What the hell did cows ever do to us?

name: newwavepony
text: The best part of Mickey burgers is that on the box, Mickey is grilling them. He is shaping meat into the shape of his own head and then cooking it.

name: lechatbotte

in phillipe's dreams, in a perfect world, the fork is right next to the plate so that one could immediately dig in to that delicious god damn mickey mouse pancake.

in a perfect world...

text:
The mouth of shattered expectations, where Life tells you you are mortal and will die unfulfilled.*

name: inthetunk
text: I cannot stop laughing at the pancake.

name: expellens
text:
Man, Tacodor really knows how to undersell a pancake failure. It's not turning out exactly right... .

Oh god. The off-center pineapple mouth. The maple syrup slobber. The broken blue-berry eye... Make the pain go away, damn you!

name: mangecoeur
text: He made Mickey Mouse after his horrible car accident

name: tripperday
text: It's what a cruel Japanese mother would put in her child's bento box.

name: zapatos
text: Cottage Cheese eyebrows?  Pineapple slice mouth?  Hardly any syrup?  Fuck that pancake.

name: zapatos
text: cottage cheese?  were they really bad at making cheese, or using milk before the stamped date?

name: belgand
text: I think it's whipped cream actually.

name: zapatos
text: VAH-MITT

name: kikineko
text: Well I would cry too if Mickey Mouse was that ugly.

name: scorpio_nadir
text: So would Walt. And millions of kids.

name: greyfield
text: This is the winter of our discontent.

name: applebed
text:
[IMGS OFF]

Have some heart, Phillippe - the Disney waffle iron may have produced more fetching Mickeys, but it electrocuted people too!

name: tonyhighwind
text: Phillippe is actually hell of delighted with french Mickey.  It is a delightful spin on an old classic for him.

name: aljazeera
text: Even the silverware is imperfect to Philippe.  The pancake has been such a disappointment.

name: ouroboros
text: the one that got me hooked.

name: carlyle
text: That simplistic look of dreamy optimism of a good breakfast in panels three and four are just precious.

name: poppechan
text:
Oh, wow. I wish I hadn't been eating while I read this. Now there's noodles and broth everywhere.

Stupid laughter.

name: rayonatoilet
text: The best part is that Philippe is far more excited about the second, French imaginary pancake than the first, "Pretty close" one.

name: fresco
text: "Nooooo!"

name: griffypoo
text: The alt text makes this one for me.  Good ol' Beastie Boys.

name: angekfire
text: I just need to know...what was going to make the black parts of the non-car-accident Mickeys?

name: nans
text: Beef muscle meat can be 000-180 cut into steak, roasts or short ribs. Some cuts are processed (corned beef or beef jerky), and trimmings, usually mixed with meat from older, leaner cattle, are ground, minced or used in sausages. The blood is used in some varieties of blood sausage. Other parts that are eaten include the 000-217 oxtail, tongue, tripe from the reticulum or rumen, gland (particularly the pancreas and thymus) referred to as sweetbread, the heart, the brain chmm exam (although forbidden where there is a gre exam danger of bovine spongiform encephalopathy, BSE), the liver, the kidneys, and the tender testicles of the 000-258 bull (known in the US as calf fries, prairie oysters, or Rocky Mountain oysters). Some intestines are eaten as-is, but are used more often as natural sausage casings. The lungs and the udder are considered unfit for human consumption in the 000-232 US. Beef bones are used for making beef stock.

name: soticoto
text:
I never mentioned before...
This IS one of the greatest Achewood strips.
One of those truly worthy of a 5.

It is a grievous insult to the grandeur of this strip when posters with no indoor voice proclaim far lesser offerings to be worthy of a 5.
